intro: Ononis tridentata f. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and pointed. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats. This subspecies is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to the typical form of Ononis tridentata.
